list_definition.definition: (often with away) to throw away or waste gradually

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He frittered (away) all his money on gambling.

list_ex_of_english: I would not use the word "fritter" unconditionally with regard to the amusements of the people.
It is rather hard on the farmers that a large percentage of the money is to be frittered away on officials.
I do not want to see money frittered away and wasted unnecessarily.
Even in the regular army itself, the fervour, sense of common purpose, and ready acceptance of discipline so essential for victory in any war had frittered away.
It is breaking my heart the way we are going on, just frittering away the time and battering at closed doors.
If movements of prices and incomes are not very carefully controlled, is there not great danger that the benefits of devaluation will be frittered away?
For goodness' sake, do not fritter this away for political motives.
Such figures are within our grasp if the fruits of this labour are not frittered away through piracy.
